content.question: All of the following statements are factually accurate. Which would best explain the rebels’ demands in the passage concerning money?

choices.label: The massive inflow of silver from the Americas to Spain did not start until the second half of the sixteenth century.
A significant number of economic transactions in sixteenth-century Castile were still in the form of barters or exchanges in kind.
Charles’s election as Holy Roman Emperor in 1519 involved him in many expensive commitments outside Spain.
Charles’s economic policies in Castile were consistent with the principles of mercantilism.

content.answer: Charles’s election as Holy Roman Emperor in 1519 involved him in many expensive commitments outside Spain.
